reviews.title: worst hotel ever!!!
Disgraceful
reviews.text: We spent 12 hours at the hotel as Gulf Air transit passengers. We were transfered from the airport in an old untidy vehicle by a maniac of a driver we had to ask to slow down. We arrived at a hotel with reasonably impressive facade. The lobby area was reasonable but full of cigarette smoke to keep up appearances for the associated night club and bar,
The hallways to the room looked like they had not been vacuumed for many months and had a strong anud uninviting smell.
reviews.title: very terrible, low class hotel
Good if you are on business. Not very good for holidays.
reviews.text: The bathroom had a leaking vanity and gum boots were needed to enter and was old and shabby to boot, so we abandoned thoughts of a shower. There were long black hairs all over the pillows and doona. The lampshades were badly stained and discoloured and looked like they had been salvaged from the tip. We put the bath towels over the bed before we laid on it for a cat nap. The room had a strong smell, the air conditioner was creating arctic like temperatures but could not be adjusted, there were crumbs on the chairs and mould on the table, the curtains were coming off the rods and so we quickly decided to head to the pool area.

The lobby entrance of the Golden Tulip is deceivingly pleasant, but the rest of my experience didn't measure up. My first inkling of a problem was when I opened the door to my room and smelled a very musty odor. The carpet was worn and dirty, and the lampshades were so old and brittle that they were barely attached to their frames. In fact, there wasn't much holding them together. Although I was staying alone, I was further disappointed to see twin beds, which would have sufficed, except that they were hard as rocks and pretty uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Below Average in So Many Ways
Excellent hotel with excellent service all round.
reviews.text: After prying open the difficult mini-refrigerator door, I found that it was completely empty, without so much as a bottle of water inside. I was able to get some bottled water at no charge from room service the next day, which made me wonder why it wasn't just stocked in the room in the first place. Internet service is typically expensive, but more inconvenient that anywhere else I have been. In order to get access to the Internet, you first have to go to the Business Center to buy time, and the center is open only during "business hours". If, during off hours, you need to buy more time, you can't get access until the next day when you buy another ticket. There, obviously, has to be a better way.

The pizza restaurant on the first floor is pretty good, but I also had to listen to music from their night club until midnight, even being two floors above. There aren't any restaurants or stores within walking distance of the Golden Tulip, so even the location could have been better. Staff are fairly efficient and friendly, so I had to laugh upon checking out, when the clerk asked, "Anything from the mini-bar?".
reviews.title: Truly disgusting

reviews.text: The hotel is very easy to find and has a nice "feel" about it. We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights before departing for Greece for 3 weeks holiday. The hotel service and facilities were of a very high standard as we were booked into the executive floor and had executive service all along. We again reserved a room for our return to Saudi and after being in 5-star hotels in Greece we found this hotel should have a 7 - star rating by comparison. The food (breakfast and dinner) were excellent with a selection and spread for the connoisseur without feeling you have been ripped off again. (Drinks at the pub could be less pricey though)
reviews.title: Wasted Stop over

reviews.text: I can maybe understand that the transfer section of the hotel could be more underrated than the rest of the facilities, but I can really recommend it for the discerning traveller wanting value for his dollar !!
